FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at Pamco Dixie -- This facility contains equipment for the ammonia storage with remote and manual shutoff devices.  The temperature, pressure, and level indicator are monitored by operators.  Maintenance and operating personnel are trained to maintain and operate equipment safely.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Bayboro Fire Department, and request they respond to the emergency.

A description of our facility and regulated substance handled -- This facility is a retail outet.  We store and sell anhyrous ammonia for agricultural use.

The worst case scenario --- Our worst case scenario is failure of a 12,000 gallon stoage tank when filled to the greatest amount allowed (82%), resulting in a vapor cloud.  According to EPA's look up tables, the distance to the endpoint is 2 miles.  

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical prevention steps -- This facility complies with EPA's accident pervention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.

Five year accident history -- We have never had an accident involving anhydrous ammonia that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, or evacuation.

The emergency response program -- In the event of an emergency involving this storage tank,  it is our policy to notify the Bayboro Fire Department and request they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department; members of the fire department have inspected the storage tank.
